text: let me be specific kelsey hightower has
been saying this for a long long time
don't running your data services on
kubernetes because
things get complicated and i think this
is a first-hand experience of what he
was referring to
things may seem okay for a long long
time but then things started getting
problematic
you have the combination of tooling that
maybe wasn't
meant to run in these types of
environments
and how do you basically evolve it so
that it embraces
this distributed everything can go and
come
within milliseconds as containers do
so i'm wondering if something like
cockroachdb
which is meant to be run as a
distributed postgresql replacement
would have helped i don't know would we
have benefited from a managed post for
sql instance
maybe so maybe we should have listened
to that advice and not
run postgresql in kubernetes but all
these things
first of all they made us just
understand the stack a little bit better
and say
us mostly me and it made me realize that
simple
is best so for the 2021 setup
we're running just a very simple
stateful set
single postgresql instance that can
restore from backup
in less than one minute
